content.question: The derivative of a function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f prime of x equals, negative 1, plus the square root of, x plus, e raised to the x over 3 power, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo largeop="true">/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>. It is known that <math alttext="f of 0 equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. In which of the following intervals is there a value of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> such that <math alttext="f of x equals 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="3 is less than x, is less than 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="5 is less than x, is less than 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="6 is less than x, is less than 7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="10 is less than x, is less than 11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3 is less than x, is less than 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.7: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Definite Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
